intro: Microchilus canaliculatus, commonly known as the narrow-ribbed liverwort, is a small, non-vascular plant belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its leafy shoots and is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. The plant has a thalloid structure with a central axis and leaf-like structures arranged in a spiral pattern. It reproduces through spores, which are produced in specialized structures called sporocarps. Microchilus canaliculatus plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its native ecosystems.
